content.description:
Brass Pendant of St. Anthony of Padua Created in Kongo

The pendant depicts Saint Anthony standing and wearing a Catholic monk’s habit.
In his right hand, Saint Anthony holds a cross.
In his left hand, Saint Anthony holds a small figure, possibly an infant.
The pendant’s sheen suggests it is made of metal.
Gift of Ernst Anspach, 1999. The Metropolitan Museum of Art.
content.question: Which of the following statements best explains the presence of pendants such as the one in the image in the Kingdom of Kongo?

choices.label: The Portuguese understood that the East African city-states were united by a shared religion and Bantu language.
King Nzinga a Nkuwu and his son Nzinga Mbemba voluntarily converted their kingdom to Roman Catholicism.
Queen Njinga expanded her military by offering religious sanctuary for those who escaped Portuguese enslavement and joined her forces.
Family groups were held together by extended kinship ties in which women served as spiritual leaders in many early West and Central African societies.

content.answer: King Nzinga a Nkuwu and his son Nzinga Mbemba voluntarily converted their kingdom to Roman Catholicism.
